Key Match Events: Aaron Johnson smashed the first two balls of the innings for boundaries.
Mohammad Amir sent a searing in-dipper that flattened Navneet Dhaliwal's middle stump.
Nicholas Kirton was run out by a direct throw from Imad Wasim from the covers.
Haris Rauf claimed his 100th T20I wicket, removing Shreyas Movva.
Ravinderpal Singh was caught at slip, reducing Canada to 55 for 5 after ten overs.
Aaron Johnson fell for 52, his stumps rattled by Naseem.
Mohammad Rizwan ensured he stayed until the end, reaching his 29th T20I fifty off 52 balls.
Usman Khan hit the winning runs as Pakistan reached home in 17.3 overs.
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan won by seven wickets with 15 balls remaining.
Canada's Aaron Johnson's 44-ball 52 was impressive, but not enough against Pakistan's strong all-round performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: First time in a men's T20 World Cup match that the first two balls of an innings were hit for boundaries.
Canada faced 76 dot balls in their innings, the most in an innings at the men's T20 World Cup.
